這個項目將在 %1$s 過期
此卡將在 %1$s 過期，您可以做幾件事情來確保平穩過渡：
1. 取得新卡：您的發卡機構可能已經向您發送了一張具有新有效期限的替換卡。如果沒有，請聯絡您的發卡銀行，以了解他們是否計劃向您發送新卡以及預計何時發送。
2. 更新自動付款：如果您的卡設定了任何自動付款，例如健身房月費或 Netflix 訂閱，請務必使用新卡號和到期日期更新資訊。
3. 銷毀舊卡：當您收到新卡並且更新了所有必要的資訊後，請務必安全地銷毀舊的、過期的卡，以防止身分被盜。
Must be less than %1$d days from current time
Must be at least %1$d symbols long
Failed to create a key, not enough memory. Please check your KDF server settings.

To pass the captcha verification on an unofficial Bitwarden client, you must specify the client secret. To find it, visit Web vault / Settings / API Key.
You can add custom HTTP headers that will be sent with every request to the server.

Hold your YubiKey flat against the back of your device
Using FIDO2 WebAuthn requires using the Bitwarden Web vault version %1$s or higher. On older versions the authentication result will incorrectly be forwarded to the official Bitwarden app.
This data is protected, to continue please enter your app password.
Use biometric authentication to confirm your access and unlock this data.
You can quickly apply filters by adding a shortcut on your home screen.
There are no suggested items available for this context
A password is required to access this share
Random passphrases provide the best combination of memorability and security.
A strong password has at least %1$d characters, uppercase & lowercase letters, digits and symbols.

A catch-all email address provides users the option to receive all mail sent to their domain, even if they are sent to an email address that has not been set up for their domain. Ensure that your email hosting supports this feature before using it.

Plus addressing means any email sent to %1$s is still sent to your account. This means you can have a lot of variations on your email address to give out to different people, sites, or mailing lists. Ensure that your email hosting supports this feature before using it.

Subdomain addressing means any email sent to %1$s is still sent to your account. This means you can have a lot of variations on your email address to give out to different people, sites, or mailing lists. Ensure that your email hosting supports this feature before using it.

Passwords that have been exposed in data breaches. Such passwords should be changed immediately.
Don't use the same password on multiple websites. Generate unique passwords to improve security.
Sites that were affected by a data breach since you last changed a password. Change your password to keep your account safe.
Change the URLs that use HTTP protocol to use HTTPS protocol, as the latter utilizes the most advanced encryption available.
Sites that have two-factor authentication available but you haven't set it up yet.
Sites that have passkey available but you haven't set it up yet. It's simpler and more secure then a password.
Helps you identify missing or incomplete data in your vault. This can refer to identities with missing names or logins without usernames.
Items that have expired or are expiring soon.
Items that have one or more URIs that cover the same websites after applying the match detection.
Items that have been moved into the trash. Having too many items in the trash may slow down operations with your vault.
Folders that do not have any items in them.
Helps you identify and eliminate duplicate items in your vault.
Check data breaches by a username or email address.
App password never gets stored on the device nor sent over the network. It is used to generate a secret key that is used to encrypt the local data.
Unless you suspect unauthorized access or discover a malware on the device, there is no need to change the password if it is a strong, unique password.
Vault will be kept unlocked during the export process. The attachments are referenced in the vault's data. The attachments are never stored in an unencrypted form in the process.
Use English to ensure that your feedback doesn't get misunderstood.

We appreciate the time that you spend sending us a message. Your message goes directly to us and we use it to troubleshoot issues, make product improvements and fix problems. While we may not reply to every report, we're reviewing and working on improvements & fixing issues as fast as we can.
I'm a Software engineer from Ukraine. I specialize on app design and development.

Conceal sensitive info, such as passwords and credit card numbers

Lock the vault after a few seconds once the screen is off
Persist vault key on a disk
Vault key is persisted on an internal storage
Vault is locked after the app is unloaded from the memory
Storing a vault key on a disk is a security risk. If the device's internal storage is compromised, the attacker will gain access to the local vault data.
Require an additional confirmation button tap after a successful biometric authentication
Keep the screen on while viewing items

When you autofill a login item that has a one-time password, the notification with verification code will popup for at least the defined duration
The Premium unlocks extra features and funds a development of the app. Thank you for supporting us! ❤️

Your subscription will renew 24 hours before it expires and your Google Play account will be automatically charged at that time. You can turn auto-renewal on or off, and you can cancel your subscription at any time on Google Play. If you've never subscribed, you may be eligible for a free trial. You won't be charged if you cancel before the end of your free trial.

Encode a text as different barcodes.
Local data consists of Downloads, User settings, Vault. They are stored in the internal storage of a device, which can only be accessed by the Android system or the Keyguard.
The User settings are encrypted using a device-specific key.
The Vault is encrypted using a Key, derived from the App password using following steps:
The Salt and the Hash is then stored locally on a device, to later generate a master key to unlock the vault.
Unlocking a Vault means storing a correct Key in a device's RAM, gaining an ability to read and modify encrypted Vault.
Remote data is stored on Bitwarden servers with zero-knowledge encryption.
